Þe erl said: 'Sir, I þe pray, 3595 W Sire.
Þe sertan soth þat þou me say 3596 R sertaine.
Wheþin es þis faire lady 3597 R Whethen, W Wheym, R fayre.
Þat þou has set at met me by?' 3598 R sett, mete.
Þe knight said: 'Sir, bi my lewte, 3599 R knyght, be.
Sho es cumen fra myne awyn cuntre; 3600 R Scho, comen fro, W from, R awen contre.
Sho es my leman þat has me soght, 3601 R Askes instead of Sho es, R lemman.
And new tithandes sho haues me broght: 3602 W, R tythandes, R scho, boght.
Mi pese es made foreuermare
For þe knight þat I slogh þare, 3604 R knyght.
So þat I may wend hardily
Hame ogayn my pese to cri; 3606 R o gayne, cry.
And þarfore wil I with hir wende, 3607 R þarfor will, wend.
For to speke with ilka frende.' 3608 R frend.
'Sir, sekerly,' said þe erl þan, 3609 R sikerly.
'Me think þou has a fayre leman.'
"Whan þai had etyn and dronken inoghe, 3611 W eten, inoughe, R When.
Þai toke vp mete, and clathes drogh. 3612 R droghe.
When þe erl liked to gane, 3613 R lyked.
He toke leue at þe knyghtes leman. 3614 R lemmane.
And hastily when he was went,
Þe knight and þe lady gent 3616 R knyght.
Sone did of þe riche aray 3617 R ryche.
Þat þai had done on þat day;
Hir awyn robe sone did þai on, 3619 R awen.
And dighted hir als sho was won. 3620 R dyghted, scho.
And þan sho toke þe preue sty 3621 R scho, W priue.
Into þe toure ful hastily. 3622 R full.
Þe knight gan playnly with hir pas 3623 R knyght.
Vntil sho in hir chamber was. 3624 R Vn till scho, chaumbre.
And vnnethes was þe knyght went out
When þe erl was gane obowt; 3626 R o bout.
Vnto þe toure he takes þe way
Als hastily als euer he may;
Þare he findes his lady, 3629 R fyndes.
Keped him ful curtaysely. 3630 R full curtaisly.
"Þan was þe erl in hert ful glad 3631 R full.
When he wist þat he hir had. 3632 W Whan.
Him thoght ȝit sho was like fully 3633 R yhit scho, lyke.
To þe lady þat sat him by. 3634 R satt.
Þare þe erl dwelled al nyght, 3635 R all.
And laiked him with his lady bright. 3636 R layked, bryght.
Þat night þai wroght what þaire wils ware; 3637 R þair wyls.
And on þat wise þai met na mare. 3638 R wyse, mett no.
Herkens now, how it bifell:
On þis maner stode þat castell, 3640 R manere.
Þat þe se ran fast byside; 3641 R bi syde.
Many gode shippes gan þare bide. 3642 R gud schippes, byde.
Whils þe erl of grete honowre 3643 R gret honoure.
Lay with þe lady in þe towre, 3644 R toure.
Þe knight ordand a ship of sail, 3645 R knyght ordaind, schipp, sayle.
And gert bere þeder gude vetaille; 3646 R þider gud vetaile.
Al his gode þeder gert he bere, 3647 R All, gud þider.
Gold and siluer and oþer gere. 3648 R syluer.
"On þe morn þe erl forth gase,
And left his lady in þat place. 3650 W plase.
Vntil þe kirk þan went he sone 3651 R vn tyll, kyrk.
And herd his mes als he was wone; 3652 R mess.
And when he to þe kirk was gane, 3653 R kyrk.
Þe knyght went to þe towre onane, 3654 R toure.
And down he broght þe fayre lady 3655 R doune, fair.
Into his hows ful preuely. 3656 R full, W priuely.
And of þai toke þe clathes sone
Þat þe lady had hir on; 3658 R o pone.
Þai dight hir in þe garmentes gay 3659 R dyght.
Þat sho had on þat oþer day; 3660 R scho.
With gerlandes and with gleterand thing 3661 R garlandes.
Was sho made out of knawyng. 3662 R scho.
"When al was done als it sold be, 3663 R all, suld.
Vnto þe erl, his lord, went he.
'Sir', he sayd, 'I wald þe pray
Of a ded þis ilk day: 3666 R thing instead of ded.
Þat þou wil gif me with þi hand 3667 R will gyf.
My leman or I pas þi lond, 3668 R Mi lemman, pass.
Þat I mai wed hir to my whife; 3669 R may, wyfe.
For with hir wil I lede my lyfe.' 3670 R will.
He sayd he thoght to wed hir þan 3671 R said.
Þat had byfore ben his leman, 3672 R be fore, lemman.
For luf of God and als for drede, 3673 W lufe.
And for he sold þe better spede.
Þe erl said: 'Þat es gude scill,
And als þou sais, syr, do I will.'
"Sone þe erl cals knightes twa, 3677 W knyghtes.
And bad þam sone þat þai sold ga
And feche þe lady vnto þe kirk.
Þai war redy his wil to wirk;
To kirk þai led þat faire lady.
A preste was reuist hastily. 3682 W prieste.
Þe erl come with meri chere,
Omang al þat folk in fere.
His owin lady he toke byliue
And gaf þe knyght vntil his wiue;
Þe prest þam weddes swith sone.
And als tite als þe mes was done,
Þan was þare made grete menestrelsy;
And þe knight and his lady
Went þam forth with grete solas
To þe ship whare his godes in was.
Þe erl went with þam þartill;
Þe knight went yn with ful gude will.
"Þe lady stode still on þe sand;
Þe erl toke hir by þe hand,
And bad þe knyght sold hir take,
Euermare to be his make.
Þare þe knyght toke þe lady,
And said to þe erl: 'Sir, gramercy
Of þis and of al oþer grace.' 3701 W om. second of.
Þus of þe erl hys leue he tase;
Þe wind blew, þai went þaire way.
Þus lost þe erl his whife for ay;
He gaf hir þus þe knyght to wed;
Þarfore ful sari life he led.
"When þe knight was went with þe lady,
Þe erl wendes hame hastily;
Vntil þe toure þe way he tase,
To tel his lady how it was,
And how he had his knyght cunuayd; 3711 W conuayd.
He trowed noght how he was bitraid.
Vntil his toure þus wendes he right,
For to speke with his lady bright.
Into þe chameber gan he ga,
And loked obout, bath to and fra;
He saw no syght of his lady;
Þarfore sone he wex sary.
Of hir cowth he nothing here;
Þan he wepid with sari chere.
Vnto himself he gan him mene
Þat al was soth als he had sene.
Þan wist he it was his lady
Þat at þe mete was set him by.
To wax wise þan he bigan; 3725 W began.
Þarfore blamed him moni a man."
Þan þe maister Maxencius
Vnto þe Emperoure said þus:
"On þis wise dose þou, sir," said he,
"When þi whif spekes to þe:
Þou trowes hir tales day and nyght,
Better þan þat þou sese in sight.
And, sir," he said, "þat þis soth be,
Tomorn þou sal wele here and se—
Who has þe wrang in al þis strife,
Wheþer þi son or þi wife.
For tomorn þi son sal speke;
Þan hope I wele þou wil him wreke." 3738 W will.
Þe Emperowre sais: "Bi my swire,
Sir, þat war my moste desire.
If I mai whit who has þe right, 3741 W may.
It sal be venged at my might." 3742 W mi.
Þan þe maister wendes his way;
Þus was þe childe saued þat day.
Þe Emperice þan was ful wa
Þat þe childe was saued swa;
For wele sho wist hir was na bote
Of þat mater more to mote. 3748 W wel.

DIV2.HEAD: Here Bigins þe Fiftend Prolong. Heading W om., MS. xv.

LG.L: Þe Emperoure þan, al þat night,
In his hert he was ful lyght;
Bot þe Emperice had mekil sorow
For þe child sold speke at morow. 3752 W childe.
Þe Emperoure lay in gude pese;
Him for to preche wald sho noght prese.
On þe morn þe Emperoure
Went to kirk with grete honowre,
With many knytes of his menȝe.
And al þe burias of þat cete,
Burias wiues, and maidens bright,
Wele araid and richely dyght,
To court þai come with ful gude chere,
Þe child speche for þai wald here.
Þe Seuyn Maisters euerilkane
Come vnto þe court onane.
Smertly when þe mes was done,
Þe Emperoure him hasted sone;
Til a faire place he made him boun,
And bad þe folk þai sold syt down.
Sone he cald þe Maisters Seuyn,
And twa he gan bi names neuyn,
And bad þam feche his sone forth sone. 3771 W fech.
His cumandment bilyue was done;
Þai went to presowne with gude will,
And broght þe childe his fader vntill.
Ful klenly was he cled and dyght,
Bot he was lene and febil of myght.
Þe childe was set in middes þe place,
Right befor his fader face. 3778 W before.
Þe folk made mikil noys and shrill;
Þarfore þe childe ȝit held him still.
He thanked God of his gude grace
Whils þai made pese in þat place.
Þan stode þe child vp sone onane,
Bifore his fader and þe folk ilkane;
He bowed him ful bowsumly,
And of his fader asked mercy.
He said: "Sir, ȝe er wrethed wrang;
Þat sal ȝe wit wele or I gang.
Þe wiked wil, sir, of ȝowre wife
Has made me al þis mekil strif;
For sho had made thurgh sorceri
Thing þat I sold haue bene ded by.
I saw in þe mone and sternes all
How þat sold of me bifall:
Þat, had I spoken with any man
To seuyn days war cumen and gane,
My hert sold sone haue broken in sonder; 3797 W asonder.
Þan had my maisters bene al vnder. 3798 W maysters, under.
And for my maisters þat me ȝemed
For my sake sold noght be flemed,
Þarfore, sir, I held me still,
And sofferd what men did me till."
"Bot, fader," he said, "it fars of þe,
And right so haues þou done with me
Als did a gudeman, here bi west,
Þat his son in þe se kest,
For he said he sold be, by grace,
Richer man þan euer he was."
Þe Emperoure said: "So haue I sele,
Son, þi wordes payes me wele; 3810 W wel.
Þarfore, son, for my benzown,
Tel vs al now þat resown.
Þi maisters has al tald for þe
Tales þat ful wele liked me;
Bot, sone, a tale of þe allane
Wil like me mare þan þai ilkane;
Þarfore þi tale þou tell vs till."
He said: "Sir, gladly, at ȝowre will."

DIV2.HEAD: Þe Fiftend Tale Said þe Childe. Heading W om., MS. xv. [Story XV. Vaticinium.]

LG.L: "Syr," he said, "in þis cuntre
Wond a man, curtays and fre;
He had a son was wise and balde,
Of fully fiften winters alde.
Opon a day, in somers tyde,
Þe gudeman went by þe se-syde.
He had a ship þat new was wroght;
He bad þe mayster it sold be broght
A mile or twa opon þe se,
And himself þarin wald be.
He toke his son, als ȝe may here,
And went to ship þai bath in fere;
Þai war in will þam to solas,
In an yle þat in þe se was.
"Als þai þederward gan wende,
Twa rauenes on þaire shippes ende 3834 W ravenes.
Cried on þam loud and shill, 3835 W loude.
And ouer þaire ship þai houed still.
Þan said þe fader, with hert fre:
'Son, what may al þis noys be,
Þat þise rauens thusgat cri?
What euer sal it sygnyfy?'
"Þe child was of wit ful klene;
He said: 'I wote wele what þai me[ne]. 3842 W wot, MS. me ...
Þir twa rauens says in þaire steuyn
Þat, thurgh þe help of God of heuyn,
I sal be of so grete powste,
Fader, þat þou sal noght knaw me;
And if I wil it soffer sertayn,
Fader, þou sal be ful fayn 3848 W fayne.
For to hald my kapes sleue,
Whils I washs; þis may ȝe leue.
And more ȝit sais þe rauens twa: 3851 W says.
Þat my moder sal alswa
Be ful fayn to hald þe clathe
Whills my handes be wyped bath.' 3854 W bathe.
When þe fader herd how he sayd,
Of his wordes he was noght payd,
And til his son þan gan he say:
'Þe crakes sal ly, if I may.
What, son,' he said, 'couaites þou
To be richer þan I am now?
Nay, sertes, it sal noght be swa
Whils þat I may ride and ga.'
His semly son þan hentes he,
And kest him sone into þe se.
He turned þe ship with eger mode;
Þe child flet forth in þe flode.
"Þe fader bade þe rauens him take,
And with his body meri make; 3868 W bodi.
And hastly went he hame ogayne;
Ful wele he wend his son war slaine.
Þe child swam forth in þe se;
On God in heuyn ay thinkes he,
And specially he praied him till
To help him if it war his will.
And God of heuyn, of his grete grace,
Made him to riue vp in a place,
Opon ane ile þare, in þe se. 3877 W an.
Ful ioyful þan in hert was he.
Þe childe ȝede vpon þe land,
And thanked Ihesu of his sande. 3880 W Jesu, sand.
In þat land he lifed allane;
Foure daies mete ete he nane. 3882 W Four.
"He herd þe fowles speke him till,
And said: 'Childe, gif þe noght ill;
Ihesu wil þe help in haste; 3885 W Jesu.
Þi meschefe es now alþermaste.' 3886 W mischefe.
Þe childe knew wele þe fowles sang;
He thanked God graithly omang.
He vnderstode al fowles language,
Bath yn wod and als in cage. 3890 W Bathe.
Þai sang him cumfort wonder wele,
For he wist þaire mening ilk dele.
"Þe fift day þan come sayland
A fissher bote biside þe land.
Of þat sight ful fayn was he,
And fast he hies him to þe se.
'Help me, sir,' þus gan he cri,
'For Ihesu luf and milde Mari.' 3898 W Jesu.
Þe fissher saw þe childe allane, 3899 MS. ffissher.
And vnto him he rowed onane.
And sone when he come to þe childe,
He spak to him with wordes milde:
'Frely childe, what dose þou here?'
Þan said þe childe with simpil chere:
'Sir, help þat I war in þi bate,
And I sal tel þe al my state.'
Intil his bate he gan him bring,
And þan he talde him his asking:
How his fader kest him in þe se
For he said þat he sold be
Gretter of myght, by Goddes grace,
And richer þan his fader was;
And how he swam into þat yle,
Al he talde him in þat while. 3914 W whyle.
"Þe fissher thoght of hym pete. 3915 MS. ffissher.
'Childe,' he said, 'I sal bring þe
Vntil a kastel here nerehand,
Vnto þe kinges steward of þis land.
Þare sal þou play and meri make.'
Þe childe said: 'For Ihesu sake, 3920 W Jesu.
Bring me, if it be þi will,
Þare I may ette and drink my fill.'
Sone þai come to þe castele
Whare þe fissher was knawen wele. 3924 W Where.
He sald þe childe, I vnderstand,
Vntil þe steward of þat land.
Þe steward was of hym ful fayn;
He saw neuer fairer for sertayne: 3928 W fayrer.
He was ful cumly on to call,
Faire and curtays euer with all. 3930 W Fayre.
Þe childe wex and wele gan thryue;
Þe steward lufed hym als his lyue.
"In þat land þan was a king
Þat had grete thoght and made mornyng
For thre rauens þat cried on him ay;
In kirk, in hall, in ilka way,
Whareso he sold ryde or gane,
Þa rauens cried euer onane—
Opon þe king ay gan þai cry.
His folk þarof had grete ferly;
And al þe men of ilk cuntre
Had grete selkuth þat sight to se.
Þe king in no place [might] haue pese, 3943 MS. om. might.
For of þaire noys wald þai neuer sese; 3944 W thair noyse.
Nowþer for bow ne for sling
No man might þam oway bring.
"Þe king wald fayn oway þam wyn,
Bot he wist noght how to bygyn.
Efter his barnage has he sent,
And gert ordayn a grete parlement,
For to wit encheson why
Þat þe rauens made slike cri;
For wele he trowed þam al omell
Þat som wise man sold him tell.
When his barons wist his will,
Hastily þai come him till;
Al þe lordes on ilka syde
Come vnto þe court þat tide. 3958 W Com, courte.
Þe steward þat had þe childe in keping,
Said he wald wend vnto þe king,
If he myght here of any man
Þat þe king wele tell can
Why thre rauens opon him cry,
And what þat it might signyfy.
'Sir,' said þe child, 'par charite,
Wiltou lat me wend with þe?'
Þe steward said: 'Sen þou wil swa,
Gladly saltou with me ga.
Þe kinges wil son saltow here,
And sum gude þare may þou lere.'
"Þe steward wendes, þe childe alswa,
And with þam oþer many ma.
Vnto þe kourt þan cumen ware,
Erles, barons, both les and mare.
Þe sertayn day bifore was set;
Þarfor þe lordes, withowten let,
Come vnto þat sertayn day.
And þan þe king gert sone puruay
Al þe lordes into a hall, 3979 W All.
And set himself omang þam all.
'Sirs,' he sayd, 'ȝe sal sit downe,
And takes entent to my resowne.'
"Þan stode he vp omanges þam all,
On þe heghest place in þe hall. 3984 W highest.
'Lordinges,' he said, 'lokes omang ȝow
If any man can tel me now
Of thre rauens þat cryes on me, 3987 W the for thre.
In what stede so þat I be.
Wha can me tel, so mot I thriue,
My doghter sal he haue to wiue,
And half my kingdom ilka dele,
Þat he sal hald him paid ful wele.'
When þe king had said his will,
Al þe lordes sat stane-still;
Of al þe wise men þat þar ware,
Nane kowth gif him graith answare.
Þe steward childe þan was wele paid,
When he herd how þe kyng had said;
In his hert he thinkes wele
Þat he kowth tel him ilka dele.
Til his lord spekes he preuely, 4001 W priuely.
And sais: 'Þis tale wele tel can I, 4002 W said.
Of þe rauens þat on þe king cries,
And also what it signyfies.
If þe king will hald þat he has hight
Vnto þam þat kowth tel him right,
To tel him wil I wele warand
If he wil hald me lele couenand.'
"Þe steward said: 'Lat swilk wordes be,
For, son, þou may sone shend me;
If þou tald a wrang resown,
In euyl tyme come we to toun.'
'Sir,' said þe childe, 'drede þe nathing; 4013 W sayd.
I knaw ful wele þe fowles criyng;
Whare any singes in wode or cage
I vnderstand wele þaire langwage.'
Þe steward stode vp in þe hall
And to [þe] king þan gan he call: 4018 MS. om. þe.
'I haue a childe,' he said, 'sir kyng,
Þat can tel þe þine asking:
Why þe thre rauens opon þe cry, 4021 W rauen.
And als what it may signyfy, 3673 to 4022 (two folios following fol. 125)R omits. 4022 MS. gignyfy.
If þou will hald þat þou has hyght
Vnto þam þat can tel þe right.' 4024 W om. can, R kan tell, ryght.
"' Ȝis,' said þe king, and þarto sware, 4025 R Yhis, kyng, þare to.
'Al þat I hight and mekyl mare 4026 R All, mykell.
Sal I gif him þat me tels 4027 R Sall, gyf.
Why þe thre rauens on me ȝelles.' 4028 R Whi, yhels.
Þe steward þe childe vnto þe king led, 4029 R child, kyng.
And bad he sold noght be adred. 4030 R suld.
When þe child come to þe king, 4031 R kyng.
He bad he sold mak no lesyng. 4032 R suld.
Þe childe said: 'Sir, by God mighty, 4033 W,R child, R be, myghty.
I sal say noght bot sothfastly.' 4034 R sall.
"Þan stode þe childe vp sone onane, 4035 R child.
Bifore þe barons euerilkane. 4036 R Bi for.
On him þai loked, bath les and mare; 4037 R both less.
So faire a childe saw þai neuer are. 4038 R fair, child.
'Sirs,' he said, 'ȝe se ilkane 4039 R yhe.
How a rauen sittes and cries allane. 4040 R syttes, cryes.
Sir king,' he said, 'I tel it þe, 4041 R kyng, tell.
It es þe femal of þe thre. 4042 R female.
And, sirs,' he sayd, 'ȝe se alswa 4043 W,R said, R yhe, all swa.
How þare sittes oþer rauens twa. 4044 R syttes.
Also ȝe se þaire ferly fare,
How þe les cries on þe mare. 4046 R less cryes.
Þe mare of þam þe elder ys; 4047 W them, R is.
Þat oþer female first was his.
He held hir wele al threty ȝere; 4049 R all thretty yhere.
Þan so bifell þat corn was dere,
Þarfore þe alder hir forsoke, 4051 R þarfor.
And nothing wald he til hir loke. 4052 R till, luke.
He fled fra hir in þat dere tyme, 4053 R fro.
And on sere sides soght sho hym. 4054 R sydes, scho.
"'Þus when þe alder hir gan forsake,
Þe ȝonger toke hir to his make; 4056 R yhonger.
Þe ȝonger rauen hir toke þat tyme 4057 R yhonger.
For his felow forth with hym. 4058 R hime.
